description:
This app is so nice. I was really excited when I found I could download Wycliffe's and Tyndale's Bibles. My challenge is, not all of Tydale's Bible is available. According to the internet, Tyndale had translated all the New Testament, the books of Moses, and most of the books of the history of the Jews in the Old Testament. I cannot access these. 
Otherwise, the app is great, and I would definitely recommend it.
summary: Great app, would recommend, but has some issues

description:
Please take my advice, the people that give 1 star reviews do not know what they talk about.
1st, This app belongs to the category where it is located, that's right, this is a Science and Learning app people!. 
2nd, It needs improvements on its UI, which is very basic and not pretty by modern standards, but it works great, it is lightweight, performs fast, it has a wide variety of translations and commentaries that make studying more accessible. 
3rd, Yes, IT IS FREE! 
4th, It would be better if it would come with some basic modules already installed, with the option to add more later on. but you have to choose a set of sources to import content from out of the box, and that's all right too.

Again, some people want this app removed out of hate because they do not clearly understand the content of it. To all of you out there, please read Romans chapter 1, really, just read it. Linux is open source and the developer(s) have put hard work, sacrifice and dedication into this project, all for free.
summary: The app is an excellent tool, the bad reviews are biased though

description: Hate the bible, but I can respect the idea that the devs are trying to make another Terry Davis. (I really hope it's programmed in Holy C...)

Its a good app and in KDE exports its menu to the global menu system which is a nice touch indeed. The app is easy to use but does need to be updated to look modern by todays app standards

A small note - people giving this a one star are God haters. They actually have spent time to install then spew there nonsense which shows they are terrified by the fact that they know that one day they will stand before God in judgement at that day to account for their lives

This is my least favorite work of fiction. There are far more interesting storybooks out there guys. Not much worth learning in it as it is all unbased, scientifically and mathematically inaccurate, and mostly outdated anecdotes. Seriously, this one will bore you and make you feel sorry for the authors and fans. I recommend Marvel or Percy Jackson. The god in this book is a loser and not as cool as Zeuss or Athena.
and now it is here, below. Winter is bleak and cold. Get this app and free yourself from winter's wolfishly whinning whoas.
Err this is not science or education. This is fiction.

The app is good - there are still some things that could be better. Like when viewing Strongs definitions instead of showing them in the info panel on hover show them when clicking on a word and show the complete definition would be really helpful.
summary: Best app for bible study I currently know

description: Should be illegal to pass this off as truth.
How this is in science section?

Objective: I'm rating this 5 stars before I use the product for a corrective adjustment to the previous reviews. 

Reason: The previous reviews were not related to software development and were opinions based wholly on an ignorance (lack of understanding) of the Bible.

Opinion: Critiques should be made from knowledgeable positions and perspectives.
The app crashes when it I choose the "Install works" followed by "next" button at the beginning.
summary: Not able to get it to work. Keeps crashing

description: Very easy to use, large selection of Bible translations.

I found this in the "Learning" category. This is exactly the opposite of learning. This is clearly advertising by a bible club. It is to convince weak-minded, fearful, superstitious, barely human apes to NOT LEARN. Please remove this racist, misogynist, slave-owning, baby drowning, fig cursing, mind closing sludge from the linux world. It promotes hate.

Wonderful Open Source Application.

More Please
summary: Great App, works great on Fedora 35

description: Excellent tool for scholars and students of the Bible. Offers an entire Bible College library of works from sages down through the ages. Thank you for making this valuable resource available to the "Linux world".
This thing is robust in terms of content and would be useful to any serious person interested in religious studies of this category. So many different commentaries/translations/biblical study tools.
summary: The amount of material is impressive

all you need in open source. some negatives reviews might be based on ideology rather than actual features.
love this app on my endless os 3.6. Couldn't be happier
It has so many great resources, uses Dark Mode following system settings.

summary: Great app with a lot of features

description: При просмотре некоторых текстов он просто разъезжантся, на все окно, форматирование нарушено
